title: Quincy mayor apologizes after fierce backlash over Catholic Church abuse comments

title: ‘Making a fool of myself’: New Celtics owner Bill Chisholm opens up about hype videos he made for team
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Morning Sports Update "I knew they were going to win," Chisholm said of the videos he made before Celtics playoff games in 2024.

title: Starbucks is closing Government Center’s iconic steaming kettle location
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Business The company says the closure is part of a broader restructuring plan that targets "Grab & Go” locations and underperforming stores.
The steaming kettle adorns the Starbucks location set to close on Sunday.
Kelly Chan/Boston.

title: Tell us: What are you reading this fall?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Tell Us Whatever’s on your nightstand, we want to hear about it.
Monet Gagnon read a book in the Public Garden on a bed of fallen leaves.

(Suzanne Kreiter/Globe staff) By Annie Jonas September 26, 2025 | 10:35 AM 1 minute to read Crisp air, shorter days, and the return of sweater weather can only mean one thing — it’s the perfect season to curl up with a great book.

title: Red Sox playoff picture: Thursday’s loss to Jays means no postseason clinch … yet
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Red Sox The Red Sox will have another chance to clinch a playoff spot on Friday with a win over Detroit or an Astros loss.
Brayan Bello and the Red Sox came up short against the Blue Jays on Thursday.
Chris Young/The Canadian Press via AP By Conor Ryan September 25, 2025 3 minutes to read The Red Sox will have to wait at least another day before they can potentially clinch a spot in the playoffs.
